p: HCoV may persist in human brains, so it is assumed that long-term sequelae can develop related to emergence or aggravation of chronic neurological diseases, as it is already described for the human coronaviruses HCOV-229E and HCOV-OC43. The latter have been detected in various neurological diseases, including multiple sclerosis [ 9]. Several recent articles report associated cases of encephalitis, acute flaccid paralysis and other neurological symptoms, such as Guillain-Barr√© syndrome or ADEM, as possible complications of a HCoV infection [ 6].
